Álvaro Colom.label: Álvaro Colom
Álvaro Colom.description: Álvaro Colom, is a Guatemalan politician who was the President of Guatemala from 2008 to 2012, as well as leader of the social-democratic National Unity of Hope. Wikipedia
Education: Universidad de San Carlos de Guatemala

Álvaro de Castro.label: Álvaro de Castro
Álvaro de Castro.description: Álvaro Xavier de Castro was Prime Minister of Portugal from 20 November to 30 November 1920 and from 18 December 1923 to 6 July 1924. Wikipedia

Élie Doté.label: Élie Doté
Élie Doté.description: Élie Doté was Prime Minister of the Central African Republic from June 2005 to January 2008. Wikipedia

Étienne Tshisekedi.label: Étienne Tshisekedi
Étienne Tshisekedi.description: Étienne Tshisekedi wa Mulumba is a politician who leads the Union for Democracy and Social Progress, a political party in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Wikipedia
Étienne Tshisekedi.Born: December 14, 1932 (age 81), Kananga, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Party: Union for Democracy and Social Progress

Štefan Füle.label: Štefan Füle
Štefan Füle.description: Štefan Füle is a Czech diplomat who has served as the European Commissioner for Enlargement and European Neighbourhood Policy since February 2010. Wikipedia
Education: Moscow State Institute of International Relations

Aaron Burr.label: Aaron Burr
Aaron Burr.description:
Aaron Burr, Jr. was the third Vice President of the United States; he served during President Thomas Jefferson's first term.
After serving as a Continental Army officer in the Revolutionary War, Burr became a successful lawyer and politician. Wikipedia
Aaron Burr.type: Former Vice President of the United States
Aaron Burr.Born: February 6, 1756, Newark, New Jersey, United States
Aaron Burr.Died: September 14, 1836, Staten Island, New York City, New York, United States
Books: The Horrors of St. Domingo and Laura

Abdul Aziz al-Hakim.label: Abdul Aziz al-Hakim
Abdul Aziz al-Hakim.description: Abdul Aziz al-Hakim was an Iraqi theologian and politician and the leader of Islamic Supreme Council of Iraq, a party that has approximately 5% support in the Iraqi Council of Representatives. Wikipedia

Abdul Rahman Arif.label: Abdul Rahman Arif
Abdul Rahman Arif.description: Hajj Abdul Rahman Mohammed Arif Aljumaily was the third President of Iraq from April 16, 1966 to July 17, 1968. Wikipedia

Abdullah Ahmad Badawi.label: Abdullah Ahmad Badawi
Abdullah Ahmad Badawi.description: Tun Abdullah bin Haji Ahmad Badawi is a Malaysian politician who served as Prime Minister from 2003 to 2009. Wikipedia
Books: Islam Hadhari A Model Approach for Development and Progress

Abel Alier.label: Abel Alier
Abel Alier.description: Abel Alier Kwai is a South Sudanese politician who was in his 70s in 2007. After Sudan gained independence from the United Kingdom in 1956, Southern Sudan was not left as an independent state. This led to a deadly war a year before the independence. Wikipedia

Abel P. Upshur.label: Abel P. Upshur
Abel P. Upshur.description: Abel Parker Upshur was an American lawyer, judge and politician from Virginia. Upshur was active in Virginia state politics and later served as Secretary of the Navy and Secretary of State during the Whig administration of President John Tyler. Wikipedia
Abel P. Upshur.Born: June 17, 1790, Northampton County, Virginia, United States

Abraham Beame.label: Abraham Beame
Abraham Beame.description: Abraham David "Abe" Beame was Mayor of New York City from 1974 to 1977 as a Democrat. As such, he presided over the city during the fiscal crisis of the mid-1970s, during which the city was almost forced to declare bankruptcy. Wikipedia
Abraham Beame.Died: February 10, 2001, New York City, New York, United States

Ad Melkert.label: Ad Melkert
Ad Melkert.description: Adrianus Petrus Wilhelmus "Ad" Melkert is a Dutch politician of the Labour Party. He served as a Member of the House of Representatives from June 3, 1986 until August 22, 1994 when he became Minister ... Wikipedia

Adam Jerzy Czartoryski.label: Adam Jerzy Czartoryski
Adam Jerzy Czartoryski.description: Prince Adam Jerzy Czartoryski was a Polish-Lithuanian noble, statesman and author. He was the son of Prince Adam Kazimierz Czartoryski and Izabela Fleming. Wikipedia

Adam Malik.label: Adam Malik
Adam Malik.description: Adam Malik Batubara was Indonesia's third vice president, a senior diplomat, and one of the pioneers of Indonesian journalism. Wikipedia
Previous offices: Speaker of the Indonesian People's Representative Council (1977–1978)
Chairperson of the Indonesian People's Consultative Assembly (1977–1978)More

Adil Abdul-Mahdi.label: Adil Abdul-Mahdi
Adil Abdul-Mahdi.description: Adil Abdul-Mahdi al-Muntafiki is an Iraqi Shi'a politician, economist, and was one of the Vice Presidents of Iraq from 2005 to 2011. He was formerly the Finance Minister in the Interim government. Wikipedia

Adnan Pachachi.label: Adnan Pachachi
Adnan Pachachi.description: Adnan al-Pachachi or Adnan Muzahim Ameen al-Pachachi is a veteran Iraqi politician and diplomat. Pachachi was Iraq's Permanent Representative to the United Nations from 1959 to 1965 and Foreign Minister ... Wikipedia

Adolf Tortilowicz von Batocki-Friebe.label: Adolf Tortilowicz von Batocki-Friebe
Adolf Tortilowicz von Batocki-Friebe.description: Max Johann Otto Adolf Tortilowicz von Batocki-Friebe, usually known as Adolf von Batocki-Friebe was a German noble, lawyer and politician, and belonged to a Lithuanian noble family. Wikipedia

Adrian Severin.label: Adrian Severin
Adrian Severin.description:
Adrian Severin is a Romanian politician and Member of the European Parliament.
Adrian Severin started his politics career under the Communist rule, as Instructor at Ștefan Gheorghiu Academy, the university for Romanian Communist cadres. Wikipedia

Agus Salim.label: Agus Salim
Agus Salim.description: Haji Agus Salim was one of Indonesia's founding fathers and prominent diplomats. He played a leading role in the creation of the Indonesian constitution in 1945 and served as Indonesia's Foreign Minister between 1947 and 1949. Wikipedia

Aires Ali.label: Aires Ali
Aires Ali.description: Aires Bonifácio Baptista Ali is the former Prime Minister of Mozambique. He served as Prime Minister from 16 January 2012 to 8 October 2012 when he was sacked by Mozambican President Armando Guebuza in a cabinet reshuffle. Wikipedia

Aitzaz Ahsan.label: Aitzaz Ahsan
Aitzaz Ahsan.description: Chaudhry Aitzaz Ahsan is a Pakistani lawyer, politician and political activist. He is best known as a left-wing statesman, constitutional theorist, and Marxist intellectual, and currently serves as the ... Wikipedia
Books: The Indus saga and the making of Pakistan
The Indus Saga From Pataliputra to Partition

Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani.label: Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani
Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani.description: Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani is an influential Iranian politician and writer, who was the fourth president of Iran. He was a member of the Assembly of Experts until his resignation in 2011. He is chairman of the Expediency Discernment Council of Iran. Wikipedia

Alan García.label: Alan García
Alan García.description: Alan Gabriel Ludwig García Pérez is a Peruvian lawyer, sociologist and politician. He was the President of Peru from 1985 to 1990 and from 2006 to 2011. Wikipedia

Albert Apponyi.label: Albert Apponyi
Albert Apponyi.description: Count Albert Apponyi de Nagyappony was a Hungarian nobleman and politician from an ancient noble family dating back to the 13th century. Wikipedia
Books: Justice for Hungary Review and Criticism of the Effect of the Treaty of Trianon

Albert B. Fall.label: Albert B. Fall
Albert B. Fall.description: Albert Bacon Fall was a United States Senator from New Mexico and the Secretary of the Interior under President Warren G. Harding, infamous for his involvement in the Teapot Dome scandal. Wikipedia
Albert B. Fall.Died: November 30, 1944, El Paso, Texas, United States

Albert Forster.label: Albert Forster
Albert Forster.description: Albert Maria Forster was a Nazi German politician. Under his administration as the Gauleiter of Danzig-West Prussia during the Second World War, the local non-German population of Poles and Jews was ... Wikipedia

Alberto Gonzales.label: Alberto Gonzales
Alberto Gonzales.description: Alberto R. Gonzales was the 80th United States Attorney General, appointed in February 2005 by President George W. Bush, becoming the highest-ranking Hispanic in executive government to date. Wikipedia
Alberto Gonzales.Born: August 4, 1955 (age 58), San Antonio, Texas, United States

Aleksandar Ranković.label: Aleksandar Ranković
Aleksandar Ranković.description: Aleksandar Ranković "Leka" was a Yugoslav communist of Serbian origin considered to be the third most powerful man in Yugoslavia after Josip Broz Tito and Edvard Kardelj. Wikipedia

Alessandra Mussolini.label: Alessandra Mussolini
Alessandra Mussolini.description: Alessandra Mussolini is an Italian politician, the granddaughter of Benito Mussolini, and previously an actress and model. Wikipedia

Alex Möller.label: Alex Möller
Alex Möller.description:
Alexander Johann Heinrich Friedrich Möller, known as Alex Möller was a German politician.
Möller was born in Dortmund. He was a member of the Landtag of Baden-Württemberg from 1946 to October 5, 1961, when he was elected to the Bundestag. Wikipedia

Alexander De Croo.label: Alexander De Croo
Alexander De Croo.description: Alexander De Croo is a Flemish liberal politician, economist and businessman. He currently holds the office of Deputy Prime Minister of Belgium and Minister of Pensions. From 2009 until 2012, he was party leader of Wikipedia

Alexander Nikolaevich Yakovlev.label: Alexander Nikolaevich Yakovlev
Alexander Nikolaevich Yakovlev.description: Alexander Nikolaevich Yakovlev was a Soviet politician and historian. During the 1980s he was a member of the Politburo and Secretariat of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union. Wikipedia

Alexander Nuno Alvaro.label: Alexander Nuno Alvaro
Alexander Nuno Alvaro.description: Alexander Nuno Alvaro is a German politician and Member of the European Parliament with the Free Democratic Party of Germany, part of the Alliance of Liberals and Democrats for Europe. Wikipedia

Alexander Peacock.label: Alexander Peacock
Alexander Peacock.description:
Sir Alexander James Peacock, KCMG, Australian politician, was the 20th Premier of Victoria.
Peacock was born of Scottish descent at Creswick, the first Victorian Premier born after the gold rush of the ... Wikipedia

Alexander Tilloch Galt.label: Alexander Tilloch Galt
Alexander Tilloch Galt.description:
Sir Alexander Tilloch Galt, GCMG, PC was a politician and a father of Canadian Confederation.
He was born in Chelsea, England, the son of Scottish novelist and colonizer, John Galt by his wife Elizabeth, only daughter of Alexander Tilloch. Wikipedia

Alexandr Vondra.label: Alexandr Vondra
Alexandr Vondra.description: Alexandr "Saša" Vondra is a Czech politician, who currently serves as the Senator from Litoměřice and served on various ministerial positions from 2006 till 2012. Until the November 2012 he was also a Deputy Chairman of the Civic Democratic Party. Wikipedia

Alexandros Zaimis.label: Alexandros Zaimis
Alexandros Zaimis.description: Alexandros Zaimis was a Greek Prime Minister, Minister of the Interior, Minister of Justice, and High Commissioner of Crete. He served as Prime Minister six times. Wikipedia

Ali Ahmeti.label: Ali Ahmeti
Ali Ahmeti.description: Ali Ahmeti is the political leader of the Democratic Union for Integration, a governing political party in Republic of Macedonia. Wikipedia

Ali Alatas.label: Ali Alatas
Ali Alatas.description: Ali Alatas was an Indonesian diplomat of Ba 'Alawi sada descent, who served as the country's foreign minister from 1988 to 1999. He was Indonesia's longest serving foreign minister. Wikipedia
Previous offices: Minister for Foreign Affairs  of Indonesia (1988–1998)

Allen J. Ellender.label: Allen J. Ellender
Allen J. Ellender.description: Allen Joseph Ellender was a popular U.S. senator from Houma in Terrebonne Parish in south Louisiana, who served from 1937 until 1972 when he died in office at the age of eighty-one. Wikipedia
Allen J. Ellender.Died: July 27, 1972, Walter Reed National Military Medical Center

Alphonso Jackson.label: Alphonso Jackson
Alphonso Jackson.description: Alphonso Jackson served as the 13th United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. He was nominated by President George W. Bush on January 28, 2004 and confirmed by the Senate on March 31, 2004. Wikipedia
Previous office: United States Secretary of Housing and Urban Development (2004–2008)

Alpha Oumar Konaré.label: Alpha Oumar Konaré
Alpha Oumar Konaré.description: Alpha Oumar Konaré was the President of Mali for two five-year terms, and was Chairperson of the African Union Commission from 2003 to 2008. Wikipedia

Alphonso Taft.label: Alphonso Taft
Alphonso Taft.description: Alphonso Taft was a jurist, the Attorney General and Secretary of War under President Ulysses S. Grant, a diplomat, and the founder of an American political dynasty. Wikipedia
Alphonso Taft.Died: May 21, 1891, San Diego, California, United States

Amado Boudou.label: Amado Boudou
Amado Boudou.description: Amado Boudou is an Argentine businessman and government policy maker who has served as the 35th Vice President of Argentina since December 2011. He was previously Minister of the Economy from 2009 to 2011. Wikipedia
Education: National University of Mar del Plata

Amara Essy.label: Amara Essy
Amara Essy.description: Amara Essy is a diplomat from Ivory Coast. Wikipedia

Amos Kendall.label: Amos Kendall
Amos Kendall.description: Amos Kendall was an American lawyer, journalist and politician. He rose to prominence as editor-in-chief of the Argus of Western America, an influential newspaper in Frankfort, the capital of the U.S. state of Kentucky. Wikipedia

Ana Pauker.label: Ana Pauker
Ana Pauker.description: Ana Pauker was a Romanian communist leader and served as the country's foreign minister in the late 1940s and early 1950s. She was the unofficial leader of the Romanian Communist Party after World War II. Wikipedia

Anatoly Sobchak.label: Anatoly Sobchak
Anatoly Sobchak.description: Anatoly Alexandrovich Sobchak was a Russian politician, a co-author of the Constitution of the Russian Federation, the first democratically elected mayor of Saint Petersburg, and a mentor and teacher of both Vladimir Putin and Dmitry Medvedev. Wikipedia

Andrés Avelino Cáceres.label: Andrés Avelino Cáceres
Andrés Avelino Cáceres.description: Andrés Avelino Cáceres Dorregaray was three times President of Peru during the 19th century, from 1884 to 1885, then from 1886 to 1890, and again from 1894 to 1895. Wikipedia

Andris Bērziņš (Latvian President).label: Andris Bērziņš
Andris Bērziņš (Latvian President).description: Andris Bērziņš is a Latvian businessman and politician. He is the President of Latvia, having won the presidential election held on 2 June 2011. From 1993 to 2004, Bērziņš was the President of Unibanka. Wikipedia

Andrés de Santa Cruz.label: Andrés de Santa Cruz
Andrés de Santa Cruz.description: Andrés de Santa Cruz y Calahumana was President of Peru and Bolivia. He also served as Supreme Protector of the short-lived Peru-Bolivian Confederation, a political entity created mainly by his personal endeavors. Wikipedia

Andrei Kirilenko (politician).label: Andrei Kirilenko
Andrei Kirilenko (politician).description: Andrei Pavlovich Kirilenko was a Soviet statesman from the start to the end of the Cold War. In 1906, Kirilenko was born at Alexeyevka in Belgorod Oblast to a Russian working-class family. Wikipedia
Party: Communist Party of the Soviet Union

Andrzej Błasik.label: Andrzej Błasik
Andrzej Błasik.description: Andrzej Eugeniusz Błasik was a Lieutenant General in the Polish Armed Forces and a Commander of the Polish Air Force. Błasik was born in Poddębice, People's Republic of Poland. He died in the Tu-154 crash near Smolensk, Russia. Wikipedia

Angelica Singleton Van Buren.label: Angelica Singleton Van Buren
Angelica Singleton Van Buren.description: Sarah Angelica Singleton Van Buren, née Singleton, was the daughter-in-law of the 8th United States President Martin Van Buren. She was married to the President's son, Abraham Van Buren. Wikipedia
Angelica Singleton Van Buren.Born: February 13, 1818, Wedgefield, South Carolina, United States
Angelica Singleton Van Buren.Died: December 29, 1877, New York City, New York, United States
Previous office: First Lady of the United States (1839–1841)

Andrzej Stelmachowski.label: Andrzej Stelmachowski
Andrzej Stelmachowski.description: Andrzej Stelmachowski was a Polish academic and politician. Wikipedia

Angelino Alfano.label: Angelino Alfano
Angelino Alfano.description: Angelino Alfano is an Italian politician who has served in the government of Italy as minister of the interior since 28 April 2013. Wikipedia
Education: Catholic University of the Sacred Heart

Anke Fuchs.label: Anke Fuchs
Anke Fuchs.description: Anke Fuchs is a German lawyer and politician of the Social Democratic Party of Germany. She served as Federal Minister for Youth, Family and Health and as Vice President of the Bundestag. Wikipedia

Anna Harrison.label: Anna Harrison
Anna Harrison.description: Anna Tuthill Symmes Harrison, wife of President William Henry Harrison and grandmother of President Benjamin Harrison, was nominally First Lady of the United States during her husband's one-month term in 1841, but she never entered the White House. Wikipedia
Anna Harrison.Born: July 25, 1775, Walpack Township, New Jersey, United States
Anna Harrison.Died: February 25, 1864, North Bend, Ohio, United States
Previous office: First Lady of the United States (1841–1841)

Anna Bligh.label: Anna Bligh
Anna Bligh.description: Anna Maria Bligh is an Australian politician and the 37th Premier of Queensland from 2007 to 2012. Bligh was an Australian Labor Party member of the Legislative Assembly of Queensland seat of South Brisbane from 1995 to 2012. Wikipedia
Previous offices: Member of the Queensland Legislative Assembly (1995–2012)

Anne Enger.label: Anne Enger
Anne Enger.description: Anne Enger, formerly Anne Enger Lahnstein is a Norwegian politician, but out of politics for the moment, as she is County Governor of Østfold. A former leader of the Centre Party, she is best known for her opposition to the European Union. Wikipedia

Ansumane Mané.label: Ansumane Mané
Ansumane Mané.description: Ansumane Mané was a Guinea-Bissau soldier who led a 1998 uprising against the government of President João Bernardo Vieira, which caused a brief, but bloody Civil War. Wikipedia
Party: African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde

Annette Lu.label: Annette Lu
Annette Lu.description: Annette Lu Hsiu-lien was the Vice President of the Republic of China from 2000 to 2008, under President Chen Shui-bian. Wikipedia

Anneli Jäätteenmäki.label: Anneli Jäätteenmäki
Anneli Jäätteenmäki.description:
Anneli Tuulikki Jäätteenmäki, Master of Laws, was the first female Prime Minister of Finland, in office from 17 April 2003 to 24 June 2003.
She worked as a lawyer from 1981 until 1987, when she was elected to the Finnish Parliament. Wikipedia

Anote Tong.label: Anote Tong
Anote Tong.description: Anote Tong is an I-Kiribati politician with Chinese heritage who is the President of Kiribati. He won the election in July 2003 with a slim plurality of votes cast against his brother, Dr. Harry Tong and the private lawyer Banuera Berina. Wikipedia
Education: London School of Economics and Political Science

Antanas Mockus.label: Antanas Mockus
Antanas Mockus.description: Aurelijus Rūtenis Antanas Mockus Šivickas is a Colombian mathematician, philosopher, and politician. Wikipedia

Anton Rop.label: Anton Rop
Anton Rop.description: Anton Rop is a Slovenian politician. Currently, he is a vice-president of European Investment Bank. He was the fourth Prime Minister of Slovenia, from 2002 to 2004. Wikipedia

Antonio Guzmán Fernández.label: Antonio Guzmán Fernández
Antonio Guzmán Fernández.description: Silvestre Antonio Guzmán Fernández was a Dominican businessman and a politician. He was the 46th President of the Dominican Republic, from 1978 to 1982. Wikipedia

Antonio Villaraigosa.label: Antonio Villaraigosa
Antonio Villaraigosa.description: Antonio Ramón Villaraigosa is an American politician who served as the 41st Mayor of Los Angeles, California from 2005 to 2013. Wikipedia
Antonio Villaraigosa.Born: January 23, 1953 (age 61), Boyle Heights, Los Angeles, California, United States

Apolo Nsibambi.label: Apolo Nsibambi
Apolo Nsibambi.description: Apolo Robin Nsibambi is a Ugandan academic and politician who was Prime Minister of Uganda from 5 April 1999 until 24 May 2011. He was succeeded as Prime Minister by Amama Mbabazi on 24 May 2011. Wikipedia

Arnold Brecht.label: Arnold Brecht
Arnold Brecht.description: Arnold Brecht was a German jurist and one of the leading government officials in the Weimar Republic. He was one of the few democratically minded high-placed officials that opposed the Machtergreifung in 1933. Wikipedia

Arthur Porritt, Baron Porritt.label: Arthur Porritt, Baron Porritt
Arthur Porritt, Baron Porritt.description: Arthur Espie Porritt, Baron Porritt, 1st Baronet, Bt, GCMG, GCVO, CBE was a New Zealand physician, military surgeon, statesman and athlete. He served as the 11th Governor-General of New Zealand between 1967 and 1972. Wikipedia

Arthur Seyss-Inquart.label: Arthur Seyss-Inquart
Arthur Seyss-Inquart.description: Arthur Seyss-Inquart was an Austrian Nazi politician who served as Chancellor of Austria for two days – from March 11 until March 13, 1938 – before the Anschluss annexation of Austria by Nazi Germany, ... Wikipedia

Arthur St. Clair.label: Arthur St. Clair
Arthur St. Clair.description: Arthur St. Clair was an American soldier and politician. Born in Scotland, he served in the British Army during the French and Indian War before settling in Pennsylvania, where he held local office. Wikipedia
Books: The Best of Margaret St. Clair

Artur Rasizade.label: Artur Rasizade
Artur Rasizade.description: Artur Tahir oğlu Rasizadeh, often spelled as Artur Rasizade, is the Prime Minister of Azerbaijan. Rasizade was a long-time Communist Party member during the Azerbaijan SSR period. Wikipedia

Asma al-Assad.label: Asma al-Assad
Asma al-Assad.description: Asma al-Assad, is the British-Syrian First Lady of Syria. She was born to Syrian-born parents, raised and educated in the United Kingdom, and graduated from King's College London in 1996 with a bachelor's ... Wikipedia

Attila Mesterházy.label: Attila Mesterházy
Attila Mesterházy.description: Attila Mesterházy is a Hungarian politician who has been chairman of the Hungarian Socialist Party since 10 July 2010. He was the party's candidate for the position of Prime Minister of Hungary in the 2010 parliamentary election. Wikipedia

Aurélie Filippetti.label: Aurélie Filippetti
Aurélie Filippetti.description: Aurélie Filippetti is a French politician and novelist of Italian descent. Her family originates from Gualdo Tadino, Umbria. Since 16 May 2012, she is Minister of Culture and Communication in the government of François Hollande. Wikipedia

Ayub Khan (Field Marshal).label: Ayub Khan
Ayub Khan (Field Marshal).description: Muhammad Ayub Khan was a five-star general officer and statesman, serving as the second President of Pakistan and its first military dictator from 1958 until his forced resignation in 1969. Wikipedia
Ayub Khan (Field Marshal).Books: Homage to the Quaid-i-Azam, speech delivered by General Mohammad Ayub Khan, President of Pakistan, Karachi, December 25, 1958

Barbara Amiel.label: Barbara Amiel
Barbara Amiel.description: Barbara Joan Estelle Amiel, Baroness Black of Crossharbour is a British journalist, writer, and socialite. She is also the wife of former media baron Conrad Black. Wikipedia
Awards: Edgar Award for Best Fact Crime

Barbara Boxer.label: Barbara Boxer
Barbara Boxer.description:
Barbara Levy Boxer is the junior United States Senator from California. A member of the Democratic Party, she previously served in the U.S. House of Representatives.
Born in Brooklyn, New York, Boxer graduated from Brooklyn College. Wikipedia
Barbara Boxer.Born: November 11, 1940 (age 73), Brooklyn, New York, United States

Barbara Blida.label: Barbara Blida
Barbara Blida.description: Barbara Blida was a Polish political figure who served in the nation's Parliament for 16 years, including a stint as a member of the cabinet, and whose alleged controversial suicide in the midst of an ... Wikipedia

Bashar al-Assad.label: Bashar al-Assad
Bashar al-Assad.description: Bashar Hafez al-Assad is the President of Syria, General Secretary of the Ba'ath Party and Regional Secretary of the party's branch in Syria. Wikipedia

Berit Ås.label: Berit Ås
Berit Ås.description: Berit Ås is a Norwegian politician, Professor Emerita of social psychology at the University of Oslo, and feminist. She was the first leader of the Socialist Left Party and served as a Member of the Parliament of Norway 1973–1977. Wikipedia

Bernadette Chirac.label: Bernadette Chirac
Bernadette Chirac.description:
Bernadette Thérèse Marie Chirac is a French politician and the wife of the former President Jacques Chirac.
She and Chirac met while both were students at the Paris Institute of Political Studies, and were married in France on 16 March 1956. Wikipedia

Bernadette Devlin McAliskey.label: Bernadette Devlin McAliskey
Bernadette Devlin McAliskey.description: Josephine Bernadette Devlin McAliskey, usually known as Bernadette Devlin or Bernadette McAliskey, is an Irish socialist and republican political activist. Wikipedia

Bernard Dowiyogo.label: Bernard Dowiyogo
Bernard Dowiyogo.description: Bernard Annen Auwen Dowiyogo was a Nauruan politician who served as President of Nauru on seven separate occasions. During this time, he also served as a Member of Parliament for the constituency of Ubenide. Wikipedia

Bernard Henry Bourdillon.label: Bernard Henry Bourdillon
Bernard Henry Bourdillon.description: Sir Bernard Henry Bourdillon, GCMG, KBE, was a British colonial administrator who was Governor of Uganda and of Nigeria. Wikipedia

Bert Lance.label: Bert Lance
Bert Lance.description: Thomas Bertram "Bert" Lance was an American businessman who served as Director of the Office of Management and Budget under President Jimmy Carter in 1977. Wikipedia
Previous office: United States Office of Management and Budget (1977–1977)

Bev Perdue.label: Bev Perdue
Bev Perdue.description: Beverly Eaves "Bev" Perdue is an American politician and member of the Democratic Party who served as the 73rd Governor of the U.S. state of North Carolina. She was the first female governor of North Carolina. Wikipedia

Bernard Kouchner.label: Bernard Kouchner
Bernard Kouchner.description: Bernard Kouchner is a French politician, and doctor. He is the co-founder of Médecins Sans Frontières and Médecins du Monde. Wikipedia

Bill Press.label: Bill Press
Bill Press.description: William "Bill" Press is a US talk radio host, liberal political commentator and author. He was chair of the California Democratic Party from 1993 to 1996. Wikipedia

Blas Ople.label: Blas Ople
Blas Ople.description: Blas Fajardo Ople was a Filipino journalist and politician who held several high-ranking positions in the executive and legislative branches of the Philippine government, including as Senate President ... Wikipedia

Bishweshwar Prasad Koirala.label: Bishweshwar Prasad Koirala
Bishweshwar Prasad Koirala.description: Bishweshwar Prasad Koirala, commonly known as BP Koirala, was the Prime Minister of Nepal from 1959 to 1960. He led the Nepali Congress, a social democratic political party. Wikipedia

Bingu wa Mutharika.label: Bingu wa Mutharika
Bingu wa Mutharika.description: Bingu wa Mutharika was a Malawian politician and economist who was President of Malawi from May 2004 until his death. Wikipedia

Bob Hawke.label: Bob Hawke
Bob Hawke.description: Robert James Lee Hawke AC GCL is an Australian politician who was the 23rd Prime Minister of Australia and the Leader of the Labor Party from 1983 to 1991. Wikipedia

Bob Kerrey.label: Bob Kerrey
Bob Kerrey.description: Joseph Robert "Bob" Kerrey is an American politician who served as the 35th Governor of Nebraska from 1983 to 1987 and as a United States Senator from Nebraska from 1989 to 2001. Wikipedia
Books: When I was a young man
Brain in a Jar A Daughter's Journey Through Her Father's MemoryMore

Bob Graham.label: Bob Graham
Bob Graham.description: Daniel Robert "Bob" Graham is an American politician and author. He was the 38th Governor of Florida from 1979 to 1987 and a United States Senator from that state from 1987 to 2005. Wikipedia
Bob Graham.Born: November 9, 1936 (age 77), Coral Gables, Florida, United States

Bob Riley.label: Bob Riley
Bob Riley.description: Robert Renfroe "Bob" Riley is an American politician who was the 52nd Governor of Alabama from 2003 to 2011. He is a member of the Republican Party. Wikipedia
